form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Tester (for himself, Mrs. McCaskill, and Mr. Begich) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To prevent conflicts of interest relating to contractors providing background investigation fieldwork services and investigative support services.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Preventing Conflicts of Interest with Contractors Act
.

subparagraph.text: an Executive agency (as defined in section 105 of title 5, United States Code);
a military department (as defined in section 102 of title 5, United States Code);
the United States Postal Service; and

paragraph.text: the term background investigation fieldwork services means the investigatory fieldwork conducted to determine the eligibility of an individual for a security clearance or suitability for Federal employment, including—

subparagraph.text: interviews of the individual or friends, family, or other sources who might have relevant knowledge of the individual; and

clause.text: criminal and other legal records; and

paragraph.text: the term background investigation support services means the clerical, administrative, and technical support services provided to various functions critical to the background investigation process, including—

subparagraph.text: initial processing and scheduling of investigative requests;
information technology and information technology support;
imaging or copying of investigation documents; and

paragraph.text: the term quality review process means performing the final quality review of a background investigation, or assisting or facilitating the quality review or another quality assurance process, to ensure investigative, administrative, and other required standards have been met before the completed background investigation is delivered to the adjudicating agency.

section.text: After the date of enactment of this Act, the Director of the Office of Personnel Management may not award a contract to an entity under which the entity will conduct quality review processes for background investigation fieldwork services or background investigation support services that, as of the date of the award of the contract, are being conducted by that entity.
